Dear Timothy Nelson:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code COF Rule 400.10107 Employment policies and procedures;
Title & establishment
Section (1) A facility shall establish and follow written employment policies
Description and procedures that shall assure that staff are emotionally stable
and of suitable health, ability, experience, and education to
perform the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/16/25, a staff member allowed two youth to enter a storage
unit and fight. Both youths sustained hand injuries.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 1/27/25 in coordination with MDHHS Worker. CA
reported Staff 1 began working at the facility in November 2024,
and just completed her training two weeks ago. CA reported the
week of 1/12/25 was Staff 1’s first week of working as a fully
active staff. CA reported Youth B went to the clinic to be seen for
an unrelated situation, and, while at the clinic, Youth B reported
his hand hurt because of a fight with Youth A. Youth B reported
the fight occurred in a supply closet, so Supervisor was notified.
CA reported Supervisor asked Youth B some questions, and then
Supervisor involved CA as well. CA reported Youth B stated Staff
1 allowed him and Youth A into a supply closet to fight for a “30”.
CA reported a “30” means a fight for 30 seconds. CA reported he
checked the video on the pod and verified the fight occurred and
Staff 1 was present. CA reported Staff 1 was suspended pending
investigation, and she is supposed to be terminated this afternoon.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/27/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported he and
Youth B took advantage of Staff 1 (because she was a new staff)
so they could fight. Youth A reported he approached Staff 1 and
asked her if he and Youth B could “blow off some steam” by
“having a 30 with body shots”. Youth A reported Staff 1 agreed to
let them do it. Youth A reported it didn’t take any effort to convince
Staff 1 to let them fight, and she didn’t ask any questions or object
to their request. Youth A reported he was surprised Staff 1 agreed
so easily. Youth A reported Staff 1 allowed him and Youth B into
the supply closet, and Staff 1 kept the supply closet door cracked
while she stood outside of the door. Youth A reported he and
Youth B punched each other, and they each punched the wall too.
Youth A reported Staff 1 did not say anything during the fight and
2

did not try to intervene. Youth A reported they stopped fighting
because Youth B ended up hurting his hand after punching the
wall. Youth A reported he was not sure if Staff 1 was watching the
fight, but he thought Staff 1 could hear or see what was happening
because she left the door cracked and stood outside. Youth A
reported he is not aware of Staff 1 or any other staff allowing fights
like this to occur previously.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/27/25
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported he and
Youth A were in the dayroom one day, and he was sick of Youth A
talking down to him. Youth B reported he and Youth A asked Staff
1 if they could go into the storage room and “blow off some
steam”. Youth B reported they did not specify they were going to
fight or what “blow off some steam” meant. Youth B reported Staff
1 replied, “are y’all sure that’s what you want to do?”. Youth B
reported he and Youth A both said yes, so she agreed to it. Youth
B reported she opened the storage room to let them in, and then
she stood right outside the door with the door cracked. Youth B
reported he and Youth A punched each other in the storage room,
and it lasted about 30-60 seconds. Youth B reported they stopped
fighting because Staff 1 opened the door and said, “alright,
alright”. Youth B reported Staff 1 did not try to intervene or stop
them from fighting prior to that. Youth B reported he hit his hand
on the wall in the storage room, and his hand was swollen for
about a week, so he went to the clinic to have it looked at. Youth B
reported after the clinic, Supervisor approached him and asked
him about the situation. Youth B reported after he spoke with
Supervisor, CA also got involved and spoke with him about the
situation. Youth B reported he isn’t aware of any staff, including
Staff 1, allowing fighting like this to occur prior to this incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed via video conference on 2/7/25 in
coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported Youth B
approached her and asked if he and Youth A could “let off some
steam”. Staff 1 reported they didn’t tell her what they were going
to do, and she didn’t ask. Staff 1 reported Youth A told her a male
staff lets the youth into the storage room to blow off steam all the
time. Staff 1 reported Youth A did not tell her who the male staff
was, and she doesn’t know if Youth A was being truthful or if he
was saying it to manipulate the situation because she was a
brand-new staff. Staff 1 reported she asked Youth A why they had
to go into the storage room, and Youth A told her it was because
of space. Staff 1 reported she opened the storage room and let
Youth A and Youth B in, but didn’t know what they were going to
do in the room. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth B had no
3

animosity towards each other that she had witnessed, so she
would never have imagined they were going to fight. Staff 1
reported as soon as she saw they were fighting; she told them to
stop. Staff 1 reported they didn’t stop right away but did after a
couple more punches. Staff 1 reported she didn’t willingly allow
them to fight, but she admits it was against her best judgement to
allow them into the storage room and not ask more questions.
Staff 1 reported she didn’t write an incident report or notify anyone
of the incident afterwards because she was in shock. Staff 1
reported she thought the situation would just blow over. Staff 1
reported she realizes now she should have given Youth A and
Youth B a consequence, and document the incident occurred
because it likely would have avoided this investigation. Staff 1
reported she knows she didn’t follow procedure, and she takes
responsibility for her actions.
Supervisor was interviewed via phone on 2/5/25 in
coordination with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor reported he was
notified of the situation after Youth B was seen in the clinic for an
unrelated situation. Supervisor reported he spoke to Youth B and
asked him about the fight he was in. Youth B told Supervisor, Staff
1 allowed him and Youth A to “run a 30” in the closet. Supervisor
reported the fight occurred on 1/16/25, but he didn’t find out about
it until Youth A was seen in the clinic, which was about a week
later. Supervisor reported he did not speak with Youth A about the
situation. Supervisor reported he told CA about the situation right
away, and they both watched the video. Supervisor reported Staff
1 was a brand-new staff, and he didn’t have any concerns about
Staff 1 prior to this incident.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
Video footage from 1/16/25 was reviewed. Although there’s audio,
it’s difficult to hear what the individuals on the video are saying
due to the echo in the pod. Youth A, Youth B and Staff 1 are seen
in the milieu area of the pod. Youth A and Youth B are standing by
one table while Staff 1 is sitting at another table. Youth A and
Youth B walk over to the storage room. Staff 1 stood up, followed
them to the storage room, and opened the door for them to enter.
Youth A and Youth B entered the storage room. Staff 1 was
looking into the room, began shutting the door, and left it cracked
while she stood outside the door. While she is shutting the door,
one of the youth ran towards the other youth (hidden by the door)
with his fists up. While Staff 1 is outside the door, she looked into
the room through the cracked door the entire time Youth A and
Youth B are in the room. Through the crack, movement can be
seen by the youth inside the room, and the squeaking of shoes on
4

the floor of the storage room can be heard. After about 30
seconds, Youth A and Youth B exit the room laughing. Staff 1
shuts the door and followed them back into the milieu area of the
pod. Youth A and Youth B shook hands while talking and
laughing.
TOUR OBSERVATION:
A tour of the facility occurred on 1/27/25. Viewed the storage room
where Youth A and Youth B fought and took pictures of the
storage room.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Agency Response Strategy dated 1/24/25 authored by
Primary Consultant states she spoke with CA, and he noted
Staff 1 was put on administrative leave as of 1/24/25
pending investigation.
• Email from CA dated 1/28/25 states Staff 1 did not show for
their scheduled termination meeting on 1/28/25, and
instead sent a letter of resignation effective immediately.
• Medical report for Youth B dated 1/17/25 notes Youth B
was seen due to right hand soreness after punching a wall
on 1/16/25. It notes his right hand had swelling. Treatment
and restrictions were provided.
• Staff Standards of Conduct Policy states employees are to
act as role models of behavior and represent a professional
code of ethics. All employees are accountable for reporting
all matters which might endanger or undermine the welfare
of youth. Employees must report infractions to the
supervisor, so corrective action may be taken. Employees
must show responsibility to youth served, and the
community, by upholding the highest values.
• Discipline, Use of Physical Force, Managing Behavior
Control Emergencies and Use of Handle with Care
Behavior Control System Policy states anticipating and
preventing the development of potentially dangerous
situations at the facility is each employee’s responsibility.
• Staff 1 does not have any disciplinary actions in her
employee file. However, there is a termination letter dated
1/28/25 noting Staff 1 failed to pass her 6-month
probationary period due to a lack of safety and security
awareness, as well as a disregard for policies and
5

procedures in relation to the incident for this investigation.
The termination letter notes Staff 1 resigned. Staff 1
received training on the employee policy and procedure
manual (11/13/24), standards of conduct, responsibilities &
rights of employees (11/13/24), and client’s rights
(11/14/24).
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per interviews
conducted, video reviewed, and documentation reviewed, Staff 1
allowed Youth A and Youth B to go into a storage room together,
which resulted in the two-youth fighting and Youth B getting
injured. In addition, Staff 1 failed to notify anyone about the
situation verbally or in writing.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
